meanings.sent1: The old book had runkled pages.
meanings.sent2: Her runkled shirt showed signs of wear.
meanings.sent3: The runkled paper made it hard to read the words.
meanings.sent4: His runkled face told a story of a life well-lived.
meanings.sent5: The runkled leaves crunched underfoot as she walked.

meanings.sent1: The fabric runkled after being crumpled.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally runkled the paper while folding it.
meanings.sent3: The wind runkled his hair, giving him a messy look.
meanings.sent4: Time runkled the once smooth surface of the stone.
meanings.sent5: The heat caused the plastic to runkle and distort.

meanings.sent2: The runkled map was difficult to read.
meanings.sent3: His runkled forehead showed his concern.
meanings.sent4: The runkled blanket provided warmth on cold nights.
meanings.sent5: The runkled paper crinkled in her hands.
